greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sigma(A064989(n)).
comment: The odd bisection is A285703, the even bisection is the sequence itself.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 1, and for odd primes p, a(p^e) = (q^(e+1)-1)/(q-1), where q = A151799(p).
program: A064989(n) = { my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f) };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 03 2019
